solution_line_template: First find the total time Mary's trip takes: {mary_distance} feet / {mary_speed} feet/minute = <<{mary_distance}/{mary_speed}={mary_time}>>{mary_time} minutes
Then find the total time Ann's trip takes: {ann_distance} feet / {ann_speed} feet/minute = <<{ann_distance}/{ann_speed}={ann_time}>>{ann_time} minutes
Then subtract Mary's time from Ann's time to find the difference: {ann_time} minutes - {mary_time} minutes = <<{ann_time}-{mary_time}={time_difference}>>{time_difference} minutes
